sections.title: Magma Fincorp Limited Overview

elements.body: Magma Fincorp Limited (MFL) is one of the leading non-banking financial companies based in Kolkata and registered with the Reserve Bank of India as an Asset Finance Company. It was incorporated in 1989 and is a RBI recognized Asset Finance Company. MFL has approximately 275 branches in India and also has a well-established presence in rural and semi-rural India. The company offers car loans, home loans, refinance, used vehicle loans, SME loans, commercial vehicle loans & more.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: About Magma Car Loan

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides car loans to its customers to help them purchase a wide variety of passenger cars and multi-utility vehicles which are available through Indian car and utility-vehicle dealerships. The tenure for these loans range between 12 to 60 months. Salaried employees are offered the option of an 84-month repayment period. Magma Car Finance is offered with special privileges like personalized service and streamlined documentation that enables the customer to acquire the product faster.

sections.title: Why Choose Magma Car Loan?

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides some unique benefits to its customers, like flexible repayment options, quick processing with least possible documentation and up to full value of the car is financed (under certain conditions as laid down by the company).

sections.title: Features & Benefits of Magma Car Loan

elements.body:
• Tractable documentation and fast processing.
  • Flexible loan repayment options monthly cash instalments, auto debit, ECS and post dated cheques.
  • The company offers excellent customer service as well as end-to-end doorstep service.
  • Easy loans are provided to existing Magma customers with good repayment records for 12 months or more, without them having to submit their income documents.
  • Attractive and incomparable interest rates.
  • Loans are offered for purchase of personal and commercial-use cars or utility vehicles.
  • Customers can receive funds up to 100% of the total price of the car.
  • Salaried professionals have the option to avail a loan which is up to three-times their annual salary and self-employed professionals can avail car loans up to six-times their annual income.

sections.title: Car Loan Schemes offered by Magma:

elements.body:
Tatkal Loan Scheme:

Under this scheme, for loans worth 60-65% of ex-showroom prices on any car for commercial or personal use, the customer just has to submit their KYC documents along with latest bank statement.

Magma Privilege Scheme:

This scheme can be availed by existing Magma customers with a consistently good record of repayment for last 12 months or more. They are eligible for new loans with 1.5-times higher EMIs than that of the current loan, without having to re-submit their income documents.

Agri Land-based Funding:

This scheme offers a loan of up to 80% of the ex-showroom price on a new vehicle, if the applicant has agricultural landholding which are between three to five acres.

No Income Proof Scheme:

An applicant can get a loan with their business and property proof documents for the last two years alone, under this scheme. The applicant can avail a loan of 75% of the ex-showroom price for a B-segment car, or 65% for a C-segment car.

elements.prefix: Do not forget to renew your motor insurance on time, else you may lose out on your policy benefits! Get more info about

sections.title: Magma Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Magma offers car loans to salaried and self-employed applicants who meet the following eligibility criteria:

Salaried Customers:
  • Salaried customers should be employed under the same company/employer for a minimum period of two years.
  • The minimum age of the applicant should be at least 21 years when the car loan tenure commences and under 60 years or at retirement age, whichever is lower, when the car loan tenure concludes.
  • The annual salary of the applicant should be Rs.1,50,000 and above.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for at least one year.
Self Employed Individuals
  • The applicant should have been in the same business for a minimum period of two years.
  • He/she should meet the age criteria and be 21-years-old or above at the beginning of the loan tenure and under 67 years of age at the end of the loan tenure.
  • The applicant should have a minimum income of at least Rs. 1,00,000 annually.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for one year at least.

items.title: Documentation required for a Magma Car Loan
items.body:
Salaried

If the applicant is salaried she/he needs to submit the following documents:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Any one of the following documents:
    • Previous 2 years' Form 16 and payslip of the last month.
    • Proof of employment of being in the same organization for the past two years as well as last three months' payslips.
    • Salary certificate from the organization where the applicant is employed with corresponding proof of funds credited in their bank account.
Self-employed

Self-employed applicants need to submit:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Previous 2 years' IT returns along with income computation.
  • 3 – 6 months' bank statement.
Applicants without income proof need to submit:
  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Proof of business applicable for the last 2 years.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • If applicant is an agriculturist, he/she has to submit proof of agricultural land holding.

items.title: Magma Car Loan Interest Rates and Charges:
items.body:
1. Interest rate

    Depending on various factors, Magma car loan interest rates vary from 12% to 16%.

  2. Foreclosure charges
    • Loan prepayment can be done with a 5% of the principal outstanding charged as prepayment fee after 6 months of availing the loan.
    • Foreclosures are not allowed within 6 months from date of availing the car loan. Lock in period charges have to be paid if foreclosures are made within 6 months, if it is allowed by the company under exceptional circumstances.
  3. Late payment penalty is 3% per month.
  4. Magma Car loan processing fees are as follows:
    • For loans up to Rs. 2.50 lacs, Rs. 3500 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • For loans ranging from Rs. 2.51 lacs to 5 lacs, Rs. 4050 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • Loans over and above Rs. 5 lacs is charged a processing fee of Rs. 4625.
    • On select schemes there is no processing fee.

items.title: How to calculate EMI for Magma Car Loans?
items.body:
BankBazaar.com offers smart and easy tools to calculate EMI. Customers can calculate EMI for Magma car loans by going to the BankBazaar home page and under the Finance Tools main menu choose EMI calculators. This EMI calculator can help customers to calculate monthly EMIs to be paid towards the Car Loan . BankBazaar's car loan EMI calculator is a reliable tool designed to quickly calculate the car loan EMI payment details. The step-by-step process to calculate their Magma car loan EMIs through BankBazaar.com is annotated below:

  1. Select the 'Finance Tools' drop down menu from the main page and select the EMI calculator option. Clicking on this link will lead you directly to the EMI calculator page.
  2. Scales are available on the EMI calculator page representing different ranges such as 'Loan Amount' and 'Tenure'. Mark the requisite details on the scales as per your requirements to help the tool calculate the EMI options available.
  3. After that, the customer has to enter details such as interest rate charged by Magma for car loans, along with the processing fee. The default value is already marked in the field and can be changed if required.
  4. Clicking on 'calculate' option will provide the customer with all the details related to the Magma car loan EMI payment along with the breakup of the total interest to be paid.

Check Magma Bank Car Loan EMI

items.question: What type of four wheelers can be purchased using Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase most multi-utility vehicles and passenger cars available at Indian utility - vehicles and car dealership. Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase both new and used utility vehicles and cars.

items.question: What are the tenure options for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan customers can choose a suitable tenure option between 12 months to 60 months. Salaried customers can take up to 84 months to repay the car loan.

items.question: What are the types of Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Magma Bank offers 4 types of car loan schemes, each carefully crafted to suit varied requirements of customers. The types of Magma Bank Car Loan are as follows.

  • Tatkal car loan scheme
  • Magma Privilege Scheme
  • No Income Proof Scheme
  • Agri land based car loan

items.question: What is the maximum quantum offered under Magma Bank Car Loan schemes?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers financing up to 100% the value of car.

items.question: How long does Magma Bank take to process car loan applications?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan applications will be processed in less than 4 hours, provided the customer has submitted all required documents and completed all formalities.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer loan for four wheelers intended for commercial use?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank Car Loan is also offered for new and used commercial vehicles.

items.question: What is the maximum car loan eligibility?
items.answer: Under Magma Bank Car Loan, salaried professionals can borrow up to three times their annual salary and self employed professionals can borrow up to six times their annual income.

items.question: What are the eligibility criteria that a salaried applicant must satisfy to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must satisfy the following conditions to be able to apply for a Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The annual income of the applicant must be at least Rs. 1, 50,000.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of car loan tenure and must be under 60 years or retirement age, whichever is lower, at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have been employed by the same employer for at least 2 years.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least a year.

items.question: I am a self-employed professional. What eligibility conditions do I have to fulfill to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants must satisfy the eligibility criteria given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The applicant must be earning a minimum of Rs. 1, 00,00 per year.
  • He must have been in the same business for a period of minimum 2 years.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of loan tenure and not more than 67 years at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least 1 year.

items.question: What repayment options are available for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers an array of flexible repayment options like auto debit, ECS, Post dated cheques (PDCs) and monthly cash instalments for the customers to pay EMI.

items.question: How do I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Customers can apply online through Magma Bank web portal or visit the nearest physical branch to apply for a car loan.

items.question: Can customers apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, customers can apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No, a guarantor is not required for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What is the tatkal loan scheme under Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: In tatkal loan scheme, car loans worth upto 70% of ex-showroom price on any four wheeler, MUV or SUV for personal or commercial use are offered to customers after they submit the KYC documents along with latest bank statement. This ensures that the car loan is processed swiftly.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. Can I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, applicants with no income proof can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under "No income proof car loan scheme”. All the applicant has to submit is the property proof documents and income proof documents for the last two years to avail a loan of up to 65% of ex-showroom price for any C segment car and up to 75% the ex-showroom price for any B segment car.

items.question: What is agri based funding scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Under agri based funding scheme, applicants will be able to get up to 80% of the ex-showroom price of a new car if they have an agricultural land between 3 to 5 acres.

items.question: What is Magma Privilege scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Magma Privilege scheme is a special car loan scheme for existing customers who have maintained a clear repayment records for the last 12 months or more. Such customers are eligible for fresh car loans with EMS at 1.5 times of current loan and they will be able to secure the loan without having to submit all documents again.

items.question: I am a salaried applicant. What documents do I have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must submit the following documents to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • KYC documents including address proof, identity proof, signature and date of birth proof.
  • Any one of the income documents - salary certificates with statements showing salary credit in bank account, payslip for last 3 months with proof of employment in concerned organization for two years and form 16 for last two years plus payslip for last month.

items.question: What documents do self-employed professionals have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants have to submit the following documents while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • Bank statements for last three to six months
  • IT Returns for the last two years with income computation
  • KYC documents - identity proof, address proof, signature proof and Date of birth proof.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. What other documents do I have to submit while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
If the applicant has no income proof, he must submit the documents given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • Proof of Agri land holding, if the applicant is an agriculturist
  • Business proof for last 2 years
  • KYC documents - Proof of address, ID proof, signature proof and Date of Birth proof

items.question: I have been in my current residence for only six months. Is it possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No. In order to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you have to submit proof for resident stability for at least one year. If you are residing at own or parental house, funding will be made available with residence stability of only six months.

items.question: I do not hold a Magma Bank account. Is it still possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: To apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you will have to open a new Magma Bank account. But, you will not require recent transactions to apply for a car loan under Tatkal scheme.

items.question: Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan if there are no Magma branch offices in my area?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers car loans for customers living within a radius of 125 kilometres from any of the 280 plus offices across India.

items.question: For my loan payment structure, will I be required to select from post dated cheques or equated monthly instalments?
items.answer: No. Customers can take a car loan by submitting at least five security Post Dated Cheques (PDCs) and by making the payment of monthly instalments by direct deposit or cash at Magma Bank branches.

items.question: How do I find out my Magma Bank Car Loan EMI?
items.answer: You can find out your monthly EMI by using an online car loan EMI calculator available on BankBazaar. You will have to enter details like principal loan amount, interest rate and tenure in months to find out the EMI amount.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer customer support services for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank car loan borrowers can get in touch with the bank by filling out a form online. After the form is submitted, a Magma Bank representative will contact you. Also, you can visit any of the nearest Magma Bank branches to get your queries answered.

items.question: I am an agriculturist. Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, agriculturists can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under the Agri Land based funding scheme.

items.question: Can I prepay Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank allows prepayments for car loans after 6 months of taking the loan.

items.question: Will I incur any penalty if I prepay my Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, for prepayments, Magma Bank will charge a nominal penalty of 5% fee on the outstanding amount.

items.question: Can I use Magma Bank Car Loan to purchase a vehicle from foreign auto dealerships?
items.answer: No, Magma Bank Car Loan can be used only to purchase vehicle sold at Indian car dealerships.

elements.body: Allahabad Bank, a renowned public sector bank in India, has a diverse range of loan products in its line-up. If you are looking forward to owning your dream car anytime soon, you may consider the car loan offered by Allahabad Bank. The bank offers car loans with flexible terms based on the requirements of its customers.

sections.title: Compare Allahabad Bank car loans

elements.body:
Loan TypeInterest RateLoan AmountProcessing Fees
New car loan8.80% - 11.05%Up to 3 times monthly income/salary0.50% (Max. Rs. 8696)
Pre-owned car loan (not more than 3 years old)9.55% - 11.55%Up to 3 times monthly salary0.50% (Max. Rs. 8696)

sections.title: Why Choose Allahabad Bank Car Loan?

elements.body:
With Allahabad Bank, you can enjoy flexible loan tenures and hassle-free EMI deals.

The loan scheme is available for all kinds of customers irrespective of their professions. Some of the notable benefits of choosing Allahabad Bank are listed as follows:

  • The loan quantum offered by the bank is determined by the annual salary of the borrower. This way, borrowers can get a loan amount within their repayment capability.
  • The bank offers financing for up to 85% of the on-road price of the vehicle. For used vehicles, the agreed purchase price or the vehicle's market valuation is used as the factor for determining the loan quantum.
  • The flexible tenure offered by the bank stretches up to 84 months. Customers can choose the tenure based on their repayment ability.

sections.title: Fees and charges

elements.body:
The bank charges a prepayment penalty of 3% of the outstanding loan amount. Processing fee on a car loan is waived for employees of Allahabad Bank. The bank does not charge any documentation charges or inspection charges for car loans.

Eligibility for Allahabad Bank car loans

The car loan eligibility criteria may differ according to the type of employment of the applicant:

  • A Salaried Person should have a minimum gross monthly income of Rs.25,000.
  • An agriculturist must have a minimum of 5 acres of irrigated land holding.
  • A businessman/professional and self-employed person must be an IT assessee. IT requirement can be waived if full collateral security is produced.
  • Retired individuals drawing a monthly pension of Rs.15,000 and above can apply for car loans from Allahabad Bank.
  • A firm or company must be in profit for the past 2 years and the net profit and cash generation should be sufficient to repay the car loan.
  • The applicant must be a permanent employee and the car loan should be repaid minimum 3 months before his or her date of retirement.
  • Non-salaried persons/retired individuals can repay the loan before reaching 70 years of age.
  • Firms and companies must be in existence for minimum 2 years.

sections.title: Documents Needed to Apply for an Allahabad Car Loan

elements.body:
• Photo ID and age proof
  • Signed application form with photograph
  • Residence proof
  • Last 6 months bank statement
  • Documentation for salaried applicants:
  • Last 3 months' salary – slips
  • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  • Documentation for self-employed applicants:
  • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
  • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account
  • Overview of Allahabad bank car loan

items.question: How can I remove the hypothecation on my vehicle after the repayment of loans?
items.answer:
After the full payment of all car loan EMI dues, the car loan is considered to be closed. Once the payment is complete, you need to get the following things:

  • No-objection certificate from the lender
  • No-objection certificate from the insurer
  • Form 35 duly filled

All these documents must be submitted to the Regional Transport Office (RTO) to remove the hypothecation on your vehicle.

items.question: What is the processing time for car loans in Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: The bank promises quick processing time for people subscribing to car loans. You can get your approval within a day or two. The loan amount will be disbursed within a week in most cases.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to get a car loan from Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: For loans under Rs.20 lakh, there is no need for a guarantor to obtain a car loan from Allahabad Bank. The value of the vehicle acts as security against the loan amount. If a non-earning spouse is taking the loan, his/her earning spouse must act as the co-borrower with the bank. However, if the loan amount is more than Rs.20 lakh, one person must act as a guarantor for the loan. Moreover, collateral security must be provided as per the bank norms.

items.question: How can I apply for a car loan with Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: Allahabad Bank offers multiple ways for customers to apply for a car loan. You may visit the official website of the bank at https://www.allahabadbank.in and apply for a car loan. You may also visit the branch office and apply for a loan.

items.question: Is it possible to sell my car before completing the loan payment?
items.answer: No. Ownership transfer is done only after you complete the EMI payments and receive the no-objection certificate from the lender. Till you finish your loan payment, the vehicle will be hypothecated to the lender. Hence, it is not possible to sell your vehicle during the loan tenure.

items.question: What happens if I don't pay my EMIs on time?
items.answer: If you miss one or two EMI payments during the loan tenure, you need to pay the outstanding amount with additional penalty charges as soon as possible. It is possible to get back on track in this case. However, if you have defaulted multiple times, the bank will repossess your vehicle and claim the outstanding loan amount.

items.title: Allahabad Bank Personal Loan Interest Rates

elements.body: Dhanlaxmi Bank Ltd is an old private sector bank headquartered in Thrissur City, Kerala, India. The bank was focusing mostly on Southern states like Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala. Dhanlaxmi Bank with its rich heritage has earned the trust and goodwill of clients. It is due to their strong belief in the need to seek innovation, deliver best service and demonstrate responsibility, that they have grown from strength to strength. car loans is the ideal way to finance your new set of wheels. Now you can acquire your favourite small car, sedan or luxury vehicle with flexible repayment options. Read on to learn about the car loan eligibility and documentation requirements for the Dhanalakshmi car loan.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
1. Residence proof
  2. Photo ID and age proof
  3. Signed application form with photograph
  4. Last 6 months bank statement
  5. Documentation for salaried applicants:
    • Last 3 months salary – slips
    • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  6. Documentation for self-employed applicants:
    • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
    • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account

sections.title: Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan Details - (Updated on $date)
Interest Rate9.75% to 10.00%
Processing Fees1% of the loan amount
Loan Tenure1 year to 5 years
Pre-closure Charges2% + GST of Principal Outstanding

The above mentioned interest rates are subject to change as per the revised GST rates.

sections.title: Overview About Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan:

elements.body: Dhanalakshmi Bank Ltd was conceived in 1927 and currently has 280 branches. It is headquartered at Thrissur city and offers products and services to meet all your financial needs; including credit cards, mortgage, investment banking etc. In the loans category, car loans is one of the options which is provided at competitive interest rates and flexible repayment options. Customers can opt for new or used car loans in a quick and hassle free process.

sections.title: Why choose Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan?

elements.body: It's really no wonder that customers keep coming back to Dhanalakshmi for all their financial needs. When you choose Dhanalakshmi Bank for a car loan, you get to enjoy the many benefits like hassle-free documentation, flexible repayment etc. You can also get upto 95% financing for the car of your dreams.

sections.title: Features of Car LoanDhanalakshmi Bank

elements.body:
Flexible Repayment Tenure

The loan amount and interest charges can be repaid in up to 84 EMIs. An unique feature from Andhra bank is the option to also make the repayment in quarterly/half yearly/yearly basis. This kind of flexibility ensures that you get to choose a term of your choice, as per your budgeting requirement.

Simple Documentation

With just basic documents to meet the KYC guidelines along with paperwork relating to the proposed car, the application process is largely hassle free.

Funding

  • For a new car: 95% of the Ex showroom cost (or) 85% of the On road cost (Ex showroom cost+ Registration + Insurance + Road tax)
  • For a used car: 60% of the value of the vehicle, as valued by the approved representative of the Bank

elements.prefix: Spending a lot on cabs every day? It's smarter to buy your own car.

sections.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Dhanlaxmi Bank has set the MCLR at a benchmark rate which is effective from 7th May, 2016, for the Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan. New borrowers will be levied interest based on this system. Existing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations. The tenure based MCLR rate is as follows:

TenureRates of Interest Rate of Interest (%) p.a.
Overnight MCLR10.05%
2 days - 1 month10.05%
More than 1 month - 3 months10.05%
More than 3 months - 6 months10.35%
More than 6 months - 1 year10.45%
More than 1 year - 2 years MCLR10.50%
More than 2 years - 3 years MCLR10.80%
More than 3 years - 5 years MCLR11.00%
More than 5 years11.20%

The existing Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Base Rate = 11.40% per annum.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria for a Car Loan from Dhanalakshmi Bank

elements.body:
Salaried employee:

  • Applicant must be atleast 21 years of age
  • Maximum age of Applicant at loan maturity is 60 years
  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Must be employed for at least one year in current employment and should have at least two years of work experience in total.

Self-Employed / Professionals:

  • Applicant must be atleast 21 years of age
  • Maximum age of Applicant at loan maturity is 65 years
  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Should be in the same business for a minimum of three years

Private Limited Company and Public Limited Company:

  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Should be in the same business for a minimum of three years

sections.title: How to calculate EMI onDhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
It is a good idea to figure out the EMI before you sign your name on the cheque so you will have an idea of what exactly you are getting into. It also helps in choosing the best terms. It is easy to calculate the EMI using the car loan EMI calculator under the Finance Tools section in Bankbazaar.com.

First you should have at hand the following details: the loan amount, Rate of interest, proposed tenure and processing fee (if any).

  1. Go to Slider 1 to choose the Loan amount. Go to slider 2 to choose the tenure.
  2. In the following fields enter the interest rate and processing fee.
  3. Click on the "Calculate” button to get a detailed result which includes the EMI amount and Amortisation table. You can use these key details to make your decisions.

elements.linkText: Check Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan EMI

items.question: What are some of the other charges that I would need to pay?
items.answer:
• The processing fee for both new and used car is 1% of the loan amount.
  • The foreclosure charges is 2% + ST of Principal Outstanding
  • Cheque Bounce charges is Rs 500/- + ST
  • NOC issuance charges is NIL for 1st issuance, then it is Rs 500/- + ST

items.question: Are there any Nonrefundable fees or Part Prepayment Charges?
items.answer: No, there are not any Nonrefundable fees or Part Prepayment Charge

items.question: What are the documents required to apply for a car loan?
items.answer:
• Application Form that is duly filled.
  • Passport size colored photographs
  • Identity proof (Passport copy/ Driving License/Pan Card/ Voters ID card/ Employee ID Card (If employed with PSUs/ MNCs/ Public limited companies/other government companies)
  • Address Proof (Ration Card/Telephone Bill/Electricity Bill/ Property Tax/Receipt/Life Insurance/premium receipt/Sale Agreement/Municipality TAX receipt/ /Valid Leave and License agreement.)
  • Bank Statement – Latest 06 months bank statements
  • Additionally:
    • If you are a salaried employee; Proof of income in the form of 6 months' salary slip or Salary certificate, ITR for last 2 years and Form 16.
    • If you are a self-employed/professional; Proof of income in the form Last 3 years' ITR and One previous year ITR with Advance tax challan of current year.
    • If you are in a partnership firm, you will need the Proof of Income in the form of Audited Financials and ITRs for last three years, as well as the Partnership Deed.
    • If you are in a private or public limited company, you will need Proof of Income in the form of Audited Financials and Last three years' ITR. You will also need the Memorandum of Association/Articles of Association.

items.question: Can the status of a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan application be checked online?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers can check the status of their car loan applications on the bank's website via internet banking.

items.question: Can customers apply for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan online?
items.answer: Yes, customers can apply for a Dhanlaxmi car loan online by entering certain personal details, loan amount, residence status and employment type.

items.question: Can Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers use the joint application facility while availing the loan?
items.answer: Yes, joint applications can be made by Dhanlaxmi Bank customers along with their family members.

items.question: What is the processing fee charged by Dhanlaxmi Bank while approving new car loans?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank charges a processing fee of 1% of the availed loan amount for new car loans.

items.question: Does the applicant's CIBIL score help in determining the eligibility criteria for Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans?
items.answer: Yes, applicants are required to carry a good CIBIL score while applying for car loans with Dhanlaxmi Bank.

items.question: What are the income documents that have to be submitted while procuring a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer:
As per the employment category of the applicant the following income documents have to be furnished -

  • Salaried Individuals - Pay Slips for the last six months/ Form 16/Income Tax returns for the last two years
  • Self Employed Professionals - IT Returns Statements for the past three years / previous year's IT Returns Statement with Advance tax challan of the current year.
  • Partnership Firms/ Private/Public Limited Company - IT Returns Statements for the past three years / Audited Financial Report

items.question: What is the maximum car loan amount that will be sanctioned by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: The maximum car loan amount that will be sanctioned by Dhanlaxmi Bank is 95% of ex-showroom price of the vehicle or 85% of the on-road price.

items.question: What is the minimum loan term that can be chosen by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers?
items.answer: The minimum tenure that can be chosen by borrowers for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan is twelve months.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure that can be chosen by a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrower?
items.answer: The maximum tenure that can be chosen by borrowers for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan is up to sixty months.

items.question: Does Dhanlaxmi Bank charge any foreclosure penalty for customers closing their car loans before the completion of the loan tenure?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank charges a penalty of 2% of the outstanding amount along with the GST for customers pre-closing the car loan.

items.question: Can individuals make balance transfers from an existing car loan account to a new Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan account?
items.answer: Yes, other bank car loan customers can make balance transfers to a new Dhanlaxmi Bank loan account.

items.question: What is the evaluation process done by Dhanlaxmi Bank when a new car loan application is submitted?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank customers can download the application form and submit the form with the list of required documents. Dhanlaxmi Bank will conduct verification on the applicant and then sanction the required loan.

items.question: How long does it take for Dhanlaxmi Bank to process a car loan application?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank generally sanctions car loans with quick processing and fast disbursements and with minimum documentation requirements.

items.question: How is the interest rate determined for new car loans given by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: The interest rate for a new car loan is decided as per the base rate and is offered as a fixed interest rate by Dhanlaxmi Bank.

items.question: Can Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers contact the helpdesk through Phone Banking for addressing any queries and concerns?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers can conveniently contact the toll-free customer care helpdesk number - 1800 425 1747 or through an alternative number, 91 0487 6613000.

items.question: How can repayments be done for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer: Repayments can be done by borrowers using monthly installments through ECS debits or standing instructions.

items.question: What are the various other charges that have to be paid by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers while availing the loan?
items.answer: The other types of additional charges that have to be paid by new car loans borrowers are - documentation charges and processing charges.

items.question: Do customers have to submit a guarantor while availing a Dhanlaxmi Bank new car loans?
items.answer: No, a guarantor is not required while availing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans.

items.question: Do borrowers have to provide any security collateral while availing new car loans with Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: No, car loan customers do not have to submit any security collateral for Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans. The hypothecation of the new vehicle is only required.

items.question: What are the modes that can be used by borrowers to repay Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans can be repaid as monthly installments via Dhanlaxmi Bank accounts, post-dated cheques, direct debits or ECS.

items.question: IS it mandatory for new car loan borrowers to open a savings account with Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: No, it is not compulsory to open a savings bank account with Dhanlaxmi Bank, while availing a car loan.

items.question: What are the different kinds of cars financed by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: All kinds of private vehicles like sedan, small cars, luxury cars and pre-owned cars are financed by Dhanlaxmi Bank.

items.question: Who is eligible to avail a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer: Salaried individuals and self- employed professionals aged above 21 years, partnership firms, private and public listed companies are eligible to avail a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan.

items.question: What is the minimum income criteria that has to be met by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan applicants?
items.answer:
As per the employment category of the applicant the respective income criteria has to be met -

  • Salaried Individuals - A total work experience of two years/ One year at the current company
  • Self Employed Professionals/ Partnership Firms/ Private/Public Limited Company - Business continuity of three years.

sections.title: How to fetch the Lowest Interest Rates on Car Loans in Bangalore

elements.body:
Lenders in Bangalore offer attractive interest rates on car loans which may vary from lender to lender but did you know that you can negotiate with the lenders to offer you the lowest interest rates? That is right. Below we give you a list of things that you can do which will help you fetch the best interest rates on car loans.

  • Compare the benefits – Before you pick a particular lender to avail a car loan, ensure that you explore the benefits offered by various lenders on their car loans. Once you have done that, compare the benefits and pick a lender that offers the lowest interest rates. Many banks offer lower interest rates to its existing customers and hence, it is a good idea to check the interest rates offered on car loans by the bank where you hold an account. Some banks may also offer lower interest rates to new customers as part of a promotion and that is why, you should always shop around before picking a lender.
  • Choose a shorter repayment tenure – Many car loan applicants make the mistake of choosing longer repayment tenures as the EMI amount is lower on them. However, opting for a longer repayment tenure may prompt lenders to increase the interest rates on the car loan because it gives an impression of the applicant having a low repayment capacity. Therefore, if you wish to negotiate with your lender for a lower interest rate, choose a shorter repayment tenure.
  • Ensure that you have a good credit score – If you have a credit score of more than 750, your chances of securing a loan is higher. There are some lenders that will offer you a car loan even if your credit score is low but will charge a high interest rate. It is recommended that you check your credit scores regularly and for free on the BankBazaar website under the 'Free Credit Score' section. Once you know your credit score and if it is above 750, you can confidently approach and negotiate with the lenders to offer you a car loan at low interest rates.
  • Maintain a low debt-to-income ratio – Lenders consider the debt-to-income ratio of the applicant along with the employment status. Whether the applicant is salaried or self-employed, they should have a steady income and a low debt-to-income ratio to avail a car loan at a lower interest rate. The debt-to-income ratio is a measure of the percentage of the applicant's income spent on repayment of loans.

items.question: Can I sell my car before I finish repaying the entire loan?
items.answer: No, you will not be able to sell your vehicle before you have repaid your loan. To sell the vehicle, you will need to get a NOC (No-Objection Certificate) from the lender which the lender will provide only if you have foreclosed the loan.

items.question: Do I have to provide any collateral or security while availing a car loan?
items.answer: There is no collateral or security that you have to provide while availing a car loan as the lender will consider the vehicle itself as collateral.

items.question: How can I pay the EMI towards my car loan?
items.answer: The repayment towards your car loan can be made in three ways – Electronic Clearing Service (ECS), Standing Instruction (SI), and Post-Dated Cheques (PDCs). The first two ways of repayment are recommended as they are quicker and is less prone to errors as compared to the PDCs.

items.question: After I am done repaying my car loan, what is the process to remove the hypothecation from the Registration Certificate (RC)?
items.answer:
To remove the hypothecation from your vehicle after you have repaid the loan, you need to visit the Regional Transport Office (RTO) and submit the below-mentioned documents:

  • NOC from the RTO and your car insurance provider
  • Original Form 35
  • NOC issued by your car loan lender

You will also have to pay a fee for removing the hypothecation from your vehicle.

items.question: Can I cancel my car loan after it is sanctioned or disbursed?
items.answer: Yes, you can cancel your car loan after its approval or disbursal but a charge of Rs.1,000 will apply. In addition to this, you may also have to pay other charges such as stamp duty charges, interest accumulation, etc.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Question (FAQs) on Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan'

items.question: How can I track the status of my Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan?
items.answer: You can apply for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan directly from the Syndicate Bank website. In this case you can directly track your loan status by getting in touch with the bank. On the other hand, if you have applied for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan through a third-party website such as BankBazaar, you can log in to your profile to check the status. In case you apply for the loan through BankBazaar, you will also get regular updates on your registered email ID and phone number through email and SMS about the status of the loan. BankBazaar also has a smartphone app through which you can get push notifications.

items.question: What type of four wheelers can be purchased using Syndicate Bank Synd Vahan Car Loan?
items.answer: Syndicate Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase all types of new and second-hand four wheelers.

items.question: What extra charges will be included in the on-road price of the vehicle when calculating the loan quantum?
items.answer: On-road price includes road tax, registration charges, and insurance costs when the loan quantum is being calculated under Syndicate Bank Car Loan.

items.question: How do I get the application form for Syndicate Bank Car Loan or Synd Vahan Loan?
items.answer: An applicant who wants to apply for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or Synd Vahan Loan will be required to collect an application form. The applicant can get the application form from one of the nearest Syndicate Bank branches or visit the official website of the bank and download the application form from the portal itself.

items.question: How do I calculate the monthly EMI amount for my Syndicate Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: You can find out the EMI on your Syndicate Bank Car Loan by using the online car loan EMI calculator offered by BankBazaar. You will have to enter details like the principal amount, processing charges if any, car loan interest rate and tenure in years.

sections.title: Car Loan in Patiala – Overview

elements.body:
Various lenders offer car loans at attractive interest rates in Patiala. Car loans are also provided for different types of cars ranging from a hatchback to an SUV. In Patiala, you can avail a car loan for a new car as well as for a used car. The repayment tenure of the car loan is flexible and the process to apply for the loan is also simple. You can apply for a car loan both offline and online.

If you are availing a car loan for a used car, the make, model, and type of car will determine the amount of loan that will be provided. Most banks and NBFCs provide a car loan for a used car only if it is less than 5 years old. However, certain lenders do not provide a loan if the car is more than 3 years old.

In Patiala, most NBFCs and banks offer car loans with a floating rate of interest. However, car loans with fixed interest rates are offered by a few lenders.

sections.title: How to Fetch Low Interest Rates in Patiala

elements.body:
• Have a good credit score: It is of utmost importance that you have a good credit score. One of the main factors that determine the interest rate is your credit score. In case your credit score is low, the interest rates will be high, or your application will be rejected. Certain banks and NBFCs do not provide a car loan if your credit score is less than 650.

Lenders will also know that you are financially stable if the credit score is good. Lenders offer car loans at attractive interest rates if your credit score is good. Therefore, it is vital that you maintain a good credit history before applying for a car loan.

  • Have a low debt-to-income ratio: Lenders will always access your debt-to-income ratio before providing a car loan. In case you have any pending Equated Monthly Installments (EMIs), it is advisable that you clear them as it would increase the chances of receiving the car loan. Lenders offer car loans at high interest rates if your debt-to-income ratio is high.
  • Compare different lenders: It is important that you compare car loans from various NBFCs and banks before you opt for one. Certain lenders offer car loans at lower interest rates when compared to others. Various third-party websites such as BankBazaar.com can be used to compare car loans from various lenders. The features and benefits of the car loan can also be compared on these sites.
  • Make a higher down payment: The loan amount provided by the lender will decrease if you make a higher down payment. Lenders also offer car loans at low interest rates in case you increase the down payment. Making a high down payment will also provide the impression that you are financially stable.
  • Negotiate: In case you have a good relationship with your bank, the interest rate can be negotiated. The interest rate can be negotiated based on various factors such as the credit score, income status, and loan tenure.
  • Choose a shorter tenure: The interest rates will be high in case you opt for a longer tenure. Banks usually offer low interest rates in case the repayment tenure is less than 5 years.

Even though the EMIs are low for a long repayment tenure, the interest rates will be high. Therefore, you will be paying a higher amount at the time of maturity. You can calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator provided by BankBazaar.com. You will need to enter basic details such as the processing fee, interest rate, tenure, and loan amount to calculate the EMI. The process to use the calculator is very simple.

items.question: Do I need to provide security or collateral to avail a car loan?
items.answer: No, security or collateral need not be provided when availing a car loan. The car acts as security.

items.question: Do I need to provide a co-borrower or loan guarantor to avail a car loan?
items.answer: No, a guarantor or co-borrower need not be provided when availing a car loan. However, in case you do not meet the credit criteria, the lender may request a co-borrower or guarantor to be provided.

items.question: Am I eligible for any tax benefits for availing a car loan?
items.answer: No, you cannot avail any tax benefits for availing a car loan.

items.question: Can I include my spouse's income when calculating the loan amount?
items.answer: Yes, you can include your spouse's income when calculating the loan amount.

items.question: Can 100% financing be availed on a used car?
items.answer: Yes, few lenders offer 100% finance on the ex-showroom price of certain models. However, you must meet the eligibility criteria to avail 100% finance.

sections.title: Eligibility for RBL Bank Credit Card:

elements.body:
• RBL Bank Credit Cards are offered by the bank at its sole discretion.
  • Applicants should be at least 18 years old.
  • Up to 5 add-on cards can be availed of for parents, children and spouse. Children should also be at least 18 years old.

elements.prefix: Mr. Sharma enjoys great discounts on dining with his Credit Card. What about you?

sections.title: Documentation required for RBL Bank Credit Card:

elements.body:
Documents required will be communicated by RBL Bank at the time of applying for a credit card. You need to submit the following documents to avail of an RBL Credit Card.

  • A recent passport-sized photo.
  • ID Proof (Any one of the following)
    • PAN Card
    • Voter’s ID
    • Passport
    • Any Government Photo ID
  • Address Proof (Any one of the following)
    • Passport
    • Driving licence
    • Rental Agreement
    • Electricity/Phone/Utility Bill
    • Latest bank or credit card statement from another bank
  • Income Proof (Any one of the following)
    • Latest Salary Slip
    • Income Tax Returns
    • Bank Statements
    • Form 16

items.question: What should I do in case I lose my RBL Bank credit card?
items.answer: If you lose your RBL Bank credit card, immediately contact the 24-hour toll free customer care provided by RBL Bank. Report the lost or stolen card to the customer care. Once this is done, you will not be held liable for any transactions made on your card after.

items.question: How do I pay my RBL Bank credit card bill?
items.answer:
You can use any of the following methods to make payments towards your credit card.

  • NEFT - You can use the National Electronic Funds Transfer option. Transfer funds using the IFSC code to your credit card account.
  • Cheque - Deposit a cheque at any designated Credit Card Payment boxes at an RBL Bank branch. You can also use drop boxes offered by Skypak.
  • Cash - Visit any RBL Bank branch to make a payment in cash. Rs. 100 is charged for this service.
  • Cards Online - Log into the online portal “Cards Online” to pay your credit card bill.
  • Quick Bill Pay - Pay your credit card bill using “Quick Bill Pay” from any bank account.
  • ECS or Standing Instructions - Pay your credit card bill easily by setting standing instructions with RBL Bank to automatically debit your account to pay the minimum amount due or the full credit card bill on the payment due date.

items.question: What is the credit and cash advance limits available on RBL Bank credit cards?
items.answer: Your eligible credit limit depends on the card of your choice and your income bracket. Your cash limit will be a percentage of the available or total credit limit. This limit will be indicated on the billing statement of your credit card every month.

items.question: Why do I need add-on cards?
items.answer: Add-on cards can be taken for your family members which includes only your spouse, parents and children. You can share the benefits and convenience of a credit card with your family members. These cards will be issued under the primary card. All charges will be billed to the primary card. Reward points accumulated will also be credited to the main card. You have full control over these cards as to the credit limit you would like to allow for each add-on card.

items.question: Where can I use my RBL Bank Credit Card?
items.answer: You can use an RBL Bank credit card domestically and internationally. The card is valid at any merchant and ATM which accepts MasterCard, Maestro and Cirrus. You can also use your card to shop online.

sections.title: SBI Credit Card Overview

elements.body: State Bank of India offers multiple credit cards to meet the financial needs of individual cardholders. SBI cards offer rewards on travel, shopping, dining, and more. You can also enjoy benefits like cashback and low-interest rates, among others. If you are looking for a new credit card, take a look at the features and benefits of SBI cards to choose one that best suits you.

sections.title: Key Benefits of SBI Cards

elements.body:
All credit cards from SBI offer a range of benefits including:

  1. Save on your interest

    You can transfer your outstanding amounts from other cards to your SBI card at a low rate of interest. With the balance transfer feature, you can avoid paying interest on multiple cards.

  2. Auto payment of bills

    With your credit card, paying your utility bills is hassle free. The auto bill payment option called Easy Bill Pay allows you to make timely payments each month. You can register and pay your utility bills, insurance premiums, and electricity and telephone bills.

  3. Protect yourself with insurance

    SBI in partnership with CCP offers comprehensive protection in the event of card loss, fraud, or theft. Cardholders enjoy facilities like emergency travel assistance, banking protection, free replacement of lost card, and more.

  4. Convenient access to your account

    You can access your SBI card account online or download the SBI Card mobile app. Make bill payments, check your outstanding balance, and more anytime, anywhere.

  5. Funds for your immediate cash requirements

    Your SBI card can be very helpful if you need additional funds for an emergency. With the SBI Encash facility, you can get quick access to funds. You could get an amount above or within your credit limit transferred to your account within 48 hours with Encash. Repayment of the funds can be made in 12-, 24-, or 36-month instalments.

Credit Card Against Fixed Deposit

SBI Card Unnati - You can apply for this card against a fixed deposit. You need to have an FD of Rs.25,000 or more with State Bank of India to be eligible.
